alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 6:40AM EDT until April 15 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan... East Branch Escanaba River at Gwinn affecting Marquette County. Chocolay River near Harvey affecting Marquette County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Middle Branch Escanaba River at Humboldt affecting Marquette County. Black River near Bessemer affecting Gogebic County. .Snowmelt will lead to high river levels. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chocolay River near Harvey. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Water inundates the entire parking lot at the M-28 bridge...and the fishing pier begins to be submerged. Water inundates low lying areas along Timber Lane and Riverside Road downstream of the river gauge site * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:20 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 9.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 10.1 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage Friday evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.1 feet on 04/16/2002. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 400 PM EDT /300 PM CDT/.
